SEARCH
Package org.opensearch.sdk.api

Class SearchExtension.SearchExtensionSpec<W extends org.opensearch.common.io.stream.NamedWriteable,P>

java.lang.Object
org.opensearch.sdk.api.SearchExtension.SearchExtensionSpec<W,P>
Type Parameters:
W - the type of the main NamedWriteable for this spec. All specs have this but it isn't always *for* the same thing though, usually it is some sort of builder sent from the coordinating node to the data nodes executing the behavior
P - the type of the parser for this spec. The parser runs on the coordinating node, converting XContent into the behavior to execute
Direct Known Subclasses:
SearchExtension.AggregationSpec, SearchExtension.PipelineAggregationSpec, SearchExtension.QuerySpec, SearchExtension.RescorerSpec, SearchExtension.ScoreFunctionSpec, SearchExtension.SearchExtSpec, SearchExtension.SignificanceHeuristicSpec, SearchExtension.SortSpec, SearchExtension.SuggesterSpec
Enclosing interface:
SearchExtension
public static class SearchExtension.SearchExtensionSpec<W extends org.opensearch.common.io.stream.NamedWriteable,P> extends Object
Specification of search time behavior extension like a custom MovAvgModel or ScoreFunction.

  • Constructor Details

    • SearchExtensionSpec

      public SearchExtensionSpec(org.opensearch.core.ParseField name, org.opensearch.common.io.stream.Writeable.Reader<? extends W> reader, P parser)
      Build the spec with a ParseField.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the behavior as a ParseField. The parser is registered under all names specified by the ParseField but the reader is only registered under the ParseField.getPreferredName() so be sure that that is the name that W's NamedWriteable.getWriteableName() returns. It is an error if ParseField.getPreferredName() conflicts with another registered name, including names from other Extensions.
      reader - reader that reads the behavior from the internode protocol
      parser - parser that read the behavior from a REST request

    • SearchExtensionSpec

      public SearchExtensionSpec(String name, org.opensearch.common.io.stream.Writeable.Reader<? extends W> reader, P parser)
      Build the spec with a String.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the behavior. The parser and the reader are are registered under this name so be sure that that is the name that W's NamedWriteable.getWriteableName() returns. It is an error if this name conflicts with another registered name, including names from other Extensions.
      reader - reader that reads the behavior from the internode protocol
      parser - parser that read the behavior from a REST request

  • Method Details

      The parser responsible for converting XContent into the behavior.
